intro: Adinandra kweichovensis, commonly known as the Kweichow adinandra, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Yunnan province. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are often pale yellow or white. Adinandra kweichovensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
